title: Super Light Car - Sustainable Production Technologies of Emission reduced Light weight Car Concepts
segmentation: Ladies and gentlemen, I am glad to present you today in the name of the group Research Volkswagen.
The prison status of the EC funded project supplied car supplied car or shorts.
SLC is the acronym for Sustainable Production Technologies for CO2 emission.
Reduced lightweight car concepts.
After a short introduction about the general demands and the main challenges in the vehicle prediction, I will present you another view of the Super light car project.

This project is organized in four separate projects dealing with concept, design, manufacture, ability of the concept, enabling technology and tools, and last but not least, the demonstration and prototyping.
I will end my lecture with a summary of the steps to come and.
Little conclusion.

The demands on fuel reduced vehicles with continuously increasing demands on security and confer at the same time demands leads into this fight to a multi material lightweight needs another multi material lightweight concept.
The selection of the appropriate material in a multi material concept.
Is the result of the best possible completion of technical issues, learned profile and the compliance of environmental and legislative requirements.
Regarding the costs, we can say that in car body design the multi material design can be see as driver for affordable, lightweight design and this question is followed up in the.
Aceproject Super light car.
Here you can see the multi material concept.

Super light Car is a collaborative Arandi Project Co funded by the European Commission and there's a 6th Framework Programme and is part of the Air MD program of the European Council for Automotive Research for reducing CO2 emission in the automotive industry.
37 partners are in the Superlight Car consortium.
The organization and the coordination of the project is done by a Volkswagen, and the project started in February 2005 and will end next year.
The wool budget of the project is more than 19 million euros.

Within the Super Light Car Project is an innovative, lightweight car body for mass production developed SLC overall objective is to develop truly lightweight multi material concepts, at least 30% lighter than prison type volume cars.
This will only be possible by exploiting all lightweights.
The materials combinations the.
Different joining technologies and by filling the gap.
Unpleasant design and simulation tools which are today not able to predict Nazer multi material design reliability nor to SS affordability.
And system ability.
On this slide you can see all the partners of the consortium.

The SSE consortium includes experts from many international and national projects on manufacturing lightweight materials, passive safety, noise, reducing materials, vehicle assembly, as well as joining.
Technologies.
The SC project is divided into 4 separate projects.
The first one deals with design and can.
Except definition.
So the first step of the SLC project was to develop 3 multi material body in white preliminary concepts.
The first concept.
On the left side was a still intensive development with a cost limit of 2.5 euros per kilogram saved.
40 kilograms were saved with this approach.
The second in the middle achieved weight saving of 22 persons with an economic multimaterial approach with maximal five euros.
Per kilogram saved.
The search preliminary concept.
On the right side.
Tried to find some innovative material use and lightweight solution.
This last research concept had additional costs of 210 euros per kilogram saved at disposal in desert.
Concept was a weight saving of 41 person posse.
So.
Based on the outcome of these three research work, SLC has converged into the final SLC concept that had been further detailed and optimized until the beginning of 2008.
On this slide you can see.
The material mix and material distribution in the car as well as the design of the latest concept.
Zen prototyping phases, no starting, and the demonstrator will be by end of the year physically tested and its performance compared to the simulations.
Results.
The second step.
Project concerns the manufacture ability of the SFC concept.
In this set project are the assembly sequence, the joining technologies and the quality.
Analyzed.
Two material highlights of the concept.
Long fiber reinforced temple plastics.
Short LFTS are one of the fastest growing material in the polymer composite industry.
Their advantageous of high specific tensile properties, an recyclability have enabled them to replace metals in civil areas.
2 LFT parts are in the Super light car concept.
Museum magnesium is mainly used in the automotive industry as diecast parts in non visible areas of the car.
The Super light car projects Haskett and magnesium roof and this is an innovative use because it is a.
Alter body panel.
Another interesting technology is the resin transfer molding fibering.
First plastic are ready for large volumes, but costs are still not on the level of light metal parts.
In the SSD concept, we have three applications for RTM technology.
But the problem is.
That the more different materials we use, the more eclectic will be your joining technologies.
That's why we have here work package for joining technologies in this work package.
Are the joining methods the processing para meters and the setup for each set assembly analyze.
Undefined.
Another task of the same project 2, is the assembly cycle layout.
Indeed, the feasibility of the Superlight car concept for the production of at least 1000 cars a day is analyzed and evaluated on the right hand of the slide.
You can see a first sketch of the plan layout.
The subproject three analyzes the the enabling technologies and the tools.
The aims of this set project ours simulation analysis of costs, crash fatigue and life cycle.
One of the work package of these sub project is a characterization of the materials and the failure prediction which is really important for a multi material construction like super light car.
The fat chick prediction are done on buses of several specimens tests and as well as some model simulations.
The goal is that the results of the tests optimized denser virtual simulation.
Rules.
The SLC bridge fills the gap between Theurgy work life cycle and cost analysist.
The SLC bridge provides design engineers with a quick and easy tool for lifecycle assessment and cost analysis.
The engineers can compare.
Different design and concept alternatives based on CFD data and so they can take the right decision about material choice and design in a very early.
Early stage of the project.
Sorry as the life cycle analysis tool developed in the Super Late Car project is done automatically on the basis of the input of the design engineer Anna Material Database.
The LCA report, which considers the impact of the use of 1 material from the production of the material until its recycling, can then be used for to evaluate the impact of the use of.
One on or.
Other material.
The cast tool gives a cost breakdown for each single part.
The cast aren't divided into material labor machine, tool building and energy costs.
As for the life cycle analysis, is this cost analysis done almost at?
Matically the recycling tool is working with lifecycle tool and with the customer to predict the total recycling and recovery yields of the SLC concepts.
This is really important because we have to know in a multi material concept the recycling yield for each single material.
This kind of information will be more and more important in the future because we will need more and more different.
Chills last point.
Of this Project 3 is the virtual and physical testing of sub assemblies.
This is a very, very important validation for a multi material concepts.
Applied car fat chick.
Static reference module was different.
It is 1/2 front and made up with longitudinal rail and the suspensions.
But the last step project deals with the demonstration.
Of the project.
To demonstrate the feasibility and the weight reduction of the concept, several hardware prototypes are built until the end of this year.
Six lunch regional rails are built and will be tested on aphetic test rig.
I show you the picture two slides before.
2 front ends.
And one complete body in white will be also assemblied.
By way of conclusion, I can show you the milestone planning of the project.
You see again the three different preliminary concept which lead to the final SLC concept and the different sub project.
We are now here.
Starting with the prototyping phase of the project, which is the project for.
Automotive lightweight solutions are necessary more than ever to reduce CO2 emissions.
The project to polite car tries to use the best material for the appropriate functions.

In order to achieve an overall cost efficient, lightweight design in parallel of the hardware construction and testing issues like cost, recycling and sustainability are analyzed in the supplied car project and for the first time ever, designers have easy to use tools to consider lifecycle impact aspects right from the.
Early design phase without adding too much complexity to the decisions to be made.
And less than one year ahead of the project completion, the SL Seekers Consortium is confident to reach is ambitious targets and just make a significant step towards sustainable mass produced.
Vehicles.

I would like to use this opportunity to thank in the name of the coordination team all the set project and task leaders, the consortium partners and external organization and of course the European Community.
Thank you very much for your attention and if you have questions, please don't hesitate.
